intro: Landolphia amoena, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fleshy, orange-red berries that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Landolphia amoena is also noted for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
